Ultrasonographic technology was used to measure the effects to the skin of a novel vitamin-C-containing topical formulation:

Our study shows that topically applied vitamin C is highly efficient as a rejuvenation therapy, inducing significant collagen synthesis in all age groups with minimal side effects.

Vitamin C has long been thought to possess such rejuvenating potential, but with current technology we are better able to measure just how well it works. The treated skin actually became thicker.

The challenges surrounding vitamin C for topical use have been the molecule’s instability, absorption by the skin, and since it’s an acid, the skin can tolerate only a modest dilution (here the formula contained only 5%). On the forefront of skincare are emerging technologies that mitigate these factors.
